org.apache.juneau.urlencoding

Class UrlEncodingParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContext
        • org.apache.juneau.parser.Parser
          • org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser
            • org.apache.juneau.uon.UonParser
              • org.apache.juneau.urlencoding.UrlEncodingParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpPartParser

    public class UrlEncodingParser
extends UonParser
    Parses URL-encoded text into POJO models.
    Media types
    Handles Content-Type types: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    Description
    Parses URL-Encoded text (e.g. "foo=bar&baz=bing") into POJOs.

    Expects parameter values to be in UON notation.

    This parser uses a state machine, which makes it very fast and efficient.

    • Field Detail

      • URLENC_expandedParams

        public static final String URLENC_expandedParams
        Configuration property: Parser bean property collections/arrays as separate key/value pairs.
        Property:
        • Name: "UrlEncodingParser.expandedParams.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • UrlEncodingParserBuilder.expandedParams(boolean)
          • UrlEncodingParserBuilder.expandedParams()
          • UrlEncoding.expandedParams()
        Description:

        This is the parser-side equivalent of the URLENC_expandedParams setting.

        If false, serializing the array [1,2,3] results in ?key=$a(1,2,3).
        If true, serializing the same array results in ?key=1&key=2&key=3.

        Example:

        public class A { public String[] f1; public List<String> f2; } UrlEncodingParser p1 = UrlEncodingParser.DEFAULT; UrlEncodingParser p2 = UrlEncodingParser.create().expandedParams().build(); A a1 = p1.parse("f1=@(a,b)&f2=@(c,d)", A.class); A a2 = p2.parse("f1=a&f1=b&f2=c&f2=d", A.class);

        This option only applies to beans.

        Notes:
        • If parsing multi-part parameters, it's highly recommended to use Collections or Lists as bean property types instead of arrays since arrays have to be recreated from scratch every time a value is added to it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Reusable instance of UrlEncodingParser.

      • create

        public static UrlEncodingParserBuilder create()
        Instantiates a new clean-slate UrlEncodingParserBuilder object.

        This is equivalent to simply calling new UrlEncodingParserBuilder().

        Note that this method creates a builder initialized to all default settings, whereas builder() copies the settings of the object called on.

        Returns:
        A new UrlEncodingParserBuilder object.

      • isExpandedParams

        protected final boolean isExpandedParams()
        Configuration property: Parser bean property collections/arrays as separate key/value pairs.
        Returns:
        false if serializing the array [1,2,3] results in ?key=$a(1,2,3).
        true if serializing the same array results in ?key=1&key=2&key=3.
        See Also:
        URLENC_expandedParams
